alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:55PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clinton, southwestern Russell, eastern Monroe, Cumberland and southeastern Metcalfe Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1054 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Burkesville to near Tompkinsville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Burkesville around 1100 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
